sentences: Noored inimesed, poisid, mehed, tüdrukud, naised.
context: 'Noored' is the plural form of 'noor', which means young. In Estonian, '-d' suffix typically indicates plural for nouns when referring to people. The word refers to young people collectively, including youths in general terms. It can be used about both genders and refers specifically to individuals who are in their youth stage of life.
